actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 21, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. McClellan moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 395
actions-list.actionItem: 14 (Roll no. 33).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5764 — "To amend the Small Business Act to require small business development centers to assist small business concerns with the use of artificial intelligence, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 383
actions-list.actionItem: 8 (Roll no. 32).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5763 — "To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to modify the criteria for loans for plant acquisition, construction, conversion or expansion, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motion to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1663.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1663 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to establish in the Department of Veterans Affairs a Veterans Scam and Fraud Evasion Officer, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 659.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 659 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Chairman of the Board of Veterans' Appeals to give priority to individuals with certain professional experience in recommending such individuals to serve as members of the Board of Veterans' Appeals, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5784.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5784 — "To amend the Small Business Act to help small business concerns critically evaluate artificial intelligence tools, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5788.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5788 — "To amend title V of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to require an annual portfolio risk analysis of loans guaranteed under such title, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5764.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5764 — "To amend the Small Business Act to require small business development centers to assist small business concerns with the use of artificial intelligence, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5763.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5763 — "To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to modify the criteria for loans for plant acquisition, construction, conversion or expansion, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3496.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3496 — "To amend the Small Business Act for microloan eligibility for the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Roger Williams to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
